LEAD: Debt * First Interstate Bancorp has filed a shelf offering with the Securities and Exchange Commission for up to $1.5 billion of debt securities, which may be offered from time to time. * Guilford Mills Inc. is offering $75 million of 6 percent convertible subordinated debentures due 2012 at 100 through Bear, Stearns.

Debt * First Interstate Bancorp has filed a shelf offering with the Securities and Exchange Commission for up to $1.5 billion of debt securities, which may be offered from time to time. * Guilford Mills Inc. is offering $75 million of 6 percent convertible subordinated debentures due 2012 at 100 through Bear, Stearns. Noncallable for two years and rated Ba-1 by Moody's, the debentures are convertible into the company's common stock at $44.25 a share. * Hechinger Co. is offering $125 million of 5 1/2 percent convertible subordinated debentures due 2012 at 100 through Morgan Stanley. The debentures are convertible into the company's common stock at $27.84 a share. * Holiday Rambler Corp. has filed for $70 million of subordinated notes due 1997 through Dean Witter Reynolds Inc. as sole underwriter. * LSI Logic Corp. plans to issue $100 million of convertible Eurobonds due 2002, with an indicated coupon of 5 3/4 percent to 6 1/4 percent, through Morgan Stanley International. * Merrill Lynch & Co. is offering in the U.S. capital market $75 million (New Zealand currency) of 20 percent notes due 1989 at 100, or 1 1/2 percentage points less than comparable New Zealand rates. Interest on the notes, rated A-1 by Moody's and AA by S.& P., is paid annually instead of semiannually. * Reynolds Metals Co. has filed for $200 million of convertible subordinated debentures due 2012 through Goldman, Sachs. * Southern Natural Gas Co. has filed for $100 million of 12-year debentures through Goldman, Sachs. * Western Financial Auto Loans 2 is offering $125 million of 6 3/4 percent bonds due 1990 at a price of 99.938 to yield 6.86 percent, or 6/10 of a percentage point more than Treasury securities with a similar maturity, through Drexel Burnham Lambert as sole underwriter. The bonds are collateralized by auto loans. Common Stock * Amax Inc. has filed for 15.8 million common shares, 12.6 million to be offered in the U.S. through First Boston and the remainder overseas through Credit Suisse First Boston. * Amplicon Inc. has filed for an initial public offering of 1.65 million common shares through Kidder, Peabody. * Calton Inc. has filed for 2.5 million common shares through Merrill Lynch Capital Markets. * Meridian Insurance Group is making an initial offering of 1.5 million common shares at $12 a share through Prescott, Ball & Turben * Weyerhaeuser Co. has filed for 4 million shares of convertible exchangeable preference shares through Morgan Stanley.
